name: product-photos
description: Sort product photography by e-commerce readiness

categories.name: Hero
categories.description: Lead image quality -- clean, compelling, ready for listing

categories.name: Usable
categories.description: Good enough for gallery or secondary placement

top_priorities: Product is the clear focal point, filling the frame appropriately
Accurate color representation under neutral or white lighting
Sharp focus on the product with clean background
Professional composition that would look right on a product page
Shows the product as a customer would want to see it

must_have: Adequate lighting -- no harsh shadows obscuring product details
Product is clearly identifiable and not cropped awkwardly
highly_valued: Clean, uncluttered background (white, gradient, or contextual lifestyle)
Multiple angles or detail shots showing key features
Consistent style that would look cohesive in a product gallery
Natural color balance -- product looks like it does in person
bonus_points: Lifestyle context that helps the customer imagine owning the product
Scale reference (hand, common object) for size context
Catches the eye -- would stop someone mid-scroll

deal_breakers: Product out of focus or motion-blurred
Color cast that misrepresents the product (yellow lighting, blue tint)
Watermarks, logos, or text overlays from other sources
negative_factors: Cluttered background competing with the product for attention
Harsh shadows or blown-out highlights hiding product details
Awkward angle that doesn't show the product well
Dust, fingerprints, or imperfections visible on product
Too much negative space -- product is small in a large frame

specific_guidance: A clean shot on a white background with good lighting is almost always Hero material.
Lifestyle shots can be Hero if the product is still the clear star -- not lost in the scene.
Reject anything a customer would find misleading about the product's actual appearance.
Consistency matters: if you're building a gallery, similar style across shots is more important than any single shot being perfect.
philosophy: The customer should see exactly what they're getting. Hero shots sell; Usable shots inform; Rejects confuse or mislead.
